title: 103_hr1378
content: TITLE I--APPLICABILITY OF QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN ACQUISITION POSITIONS IN THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE. Section 1724(c)(2) of title 10, United States Code, is amended by inserting "or lower" before "grade" and "level". Section 166a of title 10, United States Code, is amended to resolve inconsistent and duplicative amendments. The Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff may provide funds to combatant commanders upon request, or to designated officers for areas not within a commander's responsibility. Additionally, duplicate section numbers in Title 10 are amended. Chapter 141 and Chapter 401 of Title 10, United States Code, are amended to redesignate certain sections. The table of sections in each chapter is updated to reflect these changes. Title 10, United States Code, is amended to update cross-references and definitions related to military history fellowships and reporting requirements. This includes changes to sections 1104, 2145(b), and 2198(c) to align with specific sections of Title 38 and the Higher Education Act of 1965. Section 2371(g) is amended to update cross-references, changing from "section 11" to "section 12" and from "sections 10 and 11" to "sections 11 and 12". Section 2372(g)(5) is also amended to replace "section 2522" with "section 2506". Additionally, sections 2401(c)(2)(A), 2501(a)(1)(A), and 2535(b)(2)(B) are amended to update references to the Internal Revenue Code of 1954, section 104, and paragraph. Section 2535(b)(2)(B) is amended to replace "paragraph (1)" with "subparagraph (A)". Section 2677(c)(1) is amended to update references from "section 21A(b)(12)(F)" to "section 21A(b)(11)(F)" and from "(12 U.S.C. 1441a(b)(12)(F))" to "(12 U.S.C. 1441a(b)(11)(F))". Section 5038(e) is amended to replace "subsection" with "section". Section 7721(a) is amended to replace "(46 U.S.C 781-790)" with "(46 U.S.C. App. 781-790)". Amendments for stylistic consistency in Title 10, United States Code are also made. In subparagraph (A)(v), "defense agency" is replaced with "Defense Agency". In subparagraph (C), amendments are made. In subparagraph (A)(v), "defense agency" is replaced with "Defense Agency" in two instances. In subsection (e), the wording is changed from "of the date" to "on the date". The table of sections in chapter 142 is updated by removing "Sec." from sections 2418 and 2419. Section 2513(c)(2)(B) is modified to include an institution of higher education designated by a State or local government. Section 2536 has the period at the end of the section heading removed. Section 2537(a) is adjusted by replacing "respectively, which" with "respectively, that". Section 2701(j)(2) is amended by removing "applies". Section 2701(j)(2) is amended by changing the wording to "(42 U.S.C. 9619(g)) applies". Section 2828 is amended to replace "per annum" with "per year" in specific subsections. Subsection headings in Title 10, United States Code are modified, including changing "Centers" to "Alliances" and "Center" to "Alliance". Section 2308 is amended to include "Facilitation of Procurement--" after "(a)". Title 10, United States Code, is amended to update references to the date of enactment and make punctuation corrections. The amendments to Title 10, United States Code include correcting punctuation errors and updating references to the date of enactment. Key changes involve correcting spelling errors in various sections such as "carrys" to "carries" and "adherance" to "adherence". Additionally, inconsistencies in words like "inconsisent" are rectified to "inconsistent". Section 2516(b)(4) is amended by changing "dual use" to "dual-use". Section 2524(b)(2)(F) is amended by replacing "work force" with "workforce". The heading of section 4313 is amended. Section 4313 of the National Matches and small-arms school expenses is amended in the table of sections in chapter 401. Section 4313 of the National Matches and small-arms school expenses is amended to remove redundant provisions and clarify amendments in Title 10, United States Code. This includes striking out certain paragraphs and subsections, and updating job placement assistance programs for members seeking employment as teachers. SEC. 202 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1993 is amended to make changes to specific sections, such as increasing percentages and correcting wording. Section 202 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1993 is amended to make changes to specific sections, such as redesignating paragraphs and amending certain provisions. Section 202 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1993 is amended by making changes to various sections, including inserting new paragraphs, amending dates, and updating references to specific sections. Section 202 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1993 is amended by making changes to various sections, including inserting new paragraphs, amending dates, and updating references to specific sections. Additionally, amendments are made to sections 1312(b)(4), 1135(c)(2), 1314(b), 1814, 1834, and 4219(c)(2)(H) by adjusting punctuation, capitalization, and wording for clarity and consistency. Section 202 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 1993 is amended by making changes to various sections, including adjustments to punctuation, capitalization, and wording for clarity and consistency. Amendments are also made to sections 4301(b)(1)(C), 4407(b)(2), 4422(a), and 4470(a) for improved language and references. Section 203 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Years 1992 and 1993 makes amendments including the repeal of Section 523 and changes to Section 236(d) for improved clarity and consistency. Amendments are made to various sections of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Years 1992 and 1993, including changes to Section 704(a), Section 3136(b)(1)(C)(ii)(I), and Section 3137(c). SEC. 204. AMENDMENTS TO OTHER LAWS. Title 37, United States Code is amended to change references from "the Veterans' Administration" to "the Department of Veterans Affairs" and to correct a typographical error in Public Law 98-94 regarding regulations. Additionally, a comma is inserted in a specific paragraph of Public Law 101-189. In the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act, a comma is inserted after "18" and the time period is changed from "six-month period" to "fiscal year" in Section 11(a)(1). SEC. 301 of TITLE III allows the Secretary of Defense and a military department to use funds for real property repairs and minor construction projects in fiscal year 1993. The funds can be used for major repair projects costing $15,000 or more, or minor construction projects costing between $15,000 and $300,000. The curr_chunk is about the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States, who is also the President of the Senate.
